Key Match Events: India beat Hong Kong by 40 runs to qualify for the Super Fours.
Suryakumar Yadav scored an unbeaten 68 off 26 balls.
Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 59 off 44 balls.
India set a target of 193 runs.
KL Rahul was dismissed after a slow 36 off 39 balls.
Hong Kong started well but lost steam once Indian spinners came into play.
Nizakat Khan and Babar Hayatt tried their best but fell short.
Ravindra Jadeja took the crucial wicket of Babar Hayatt.
Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan were expensive but managed to contain Hong Kong in the end.
Pre-Game Insights: Hong Kong won the toss and opted to bowl first.
Rohit Sharma made one change to the side, bringing in Pant for Hardik Pandya.
India's previous match against Pakistan was a thrilling last-over finish.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.
India's victory secured their spot in the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup 2022.
